definition: to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: At the top of the country's film industry, the mood is both bullish and ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利電影界的上層，充滿了昂揚和熱情洋溢的氣氛。

sentences.english: Please go on with your enthusiasm, your eagerness, and your high spirit.
sentences.chinese: 請保持你的激情，熱心和昂揚的士氣。

sentences.english: I saw that he's mature and full of will, " Maradona said.
sentences.chinese: 我能看到他的成熟和鬥志昂揚，”馬拉多納說。

sentences.english: She continued to work in a blithe spirit in spite of all difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 她不管多麼艱難繼續鬥志昂揚地工作。

sentences.english: Looking back on yesterday youth and boosting high-spirited.
sentences.chinese: 回首昨日，青春激揚，鬥志昂揚。

sentences.english: They knew of it and motivated by it.
sentences.chinese: 他們知道事業正義，並因此鬥志昂揚。

sentences.english: They went with songs to the battle, they were young.
sentences.chinese: 他們奔向戰場時哼着歌，年少力強，鬥志昂揚。

sentences.english: He spoke of his dreams passion high-spirited way, I just smiled slightly.
sentences.chinese: 他在激情昂揚地說着他夢想的時候，我只是微微地笑。

definition: full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
